channel.title: Cant connect to my server
channel.description: Ok so after i portforwarded everything correctly yes its done right, i tried to connect to my fiance's computer with the same ip and with the ip for host 127.0.0.1 and i still get error connecting to server, but it works perfectly fine on mine what is the cause?

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“Welliton_inc, post:13, topic:551492”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=670407.msg4482940#msg4482940 date=1431472594]

Er…

If you are hosting the server on your computer… Then you want her computer to connect to yours. Not the other way around.

did you look for a guide… Because http://portforward.com/ has a guide for basically every router in existence.

You have what set to “select one”? I don’t even know what you’re talking about here…

You was right they did have a guide but i still feel something is wrong here, the static ip thing i don’t need i don’t think i never used it before when doing this! but here download my rsps, edit your run and put in your updated jdk and click run.
and for the cache, put that in ur home-user or whatever so like "C:/user/home-user

https://www.dropbox.com/s/m22n09f738ngwvg/Client.rar?dl=0
[/quote]

What on earth is all this? From what I can make of your poor english, you are asking to connect your computer to your “fiances” server?

  1. What is her ip?
  2. Has she port forwarded?
  3. Make sure you replace localhost with her ip on your server files
  4. Check, “canyouseeme.org” if the port is visible
  5. If you are using No-IP, is it running in the background?
  6. Make sure the server is running…

It really isn’t hard.[/quote]

1: Her ip is same as mine.
2. Yes she has port forwarded cause i figured she would need it.
4. Yes it is.
5. Yes server is running.

Read full topic

item.title: Cant connect to my server

Er…

If you are hosting the server on your computer… Then you want her computer to connect to yours. Not the other way around.

did you look for a guide… Because http://portforward.com/ has a guide for basically every router in existence.

You have what set to “select one”? I don’t even know what you’re talking about here…
[/quote]

You was right they did have a guide but i still feel something is wrong here, the static ip thing i don’t need i don’t think i never used it before when doing this! but here download my rsps, edit your run and put in your updated jdk and click run.
and for the cache, put that in ur home-user or whatever so like "C:/user/home-user

https://www.dropbox.com/s/m22n09f738ngwvg/Client.rar?dl=0[/quote]

What on earth is all this? From what I can make of your poor english, you are asking to connect your computer to your “fiances” server?

  1. What is her ip?
  2. Has she port forwarded?
  3. Make sure you replace localhost with her ip on your server files
  4. Check, “canyouseeme.org” if the port is visible
  5. If you are using No-IP, is it running in the background?
  6. Make sure the server is running…

It really isn’t hard.

Read full topic

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The “static ip thing” is to ensure your IP address doesn’t change and ruin the port forward. In short, you should probably do it.

Read full topic

Er…

If you are hosting the server on your computer… Then you want her computer to connect to yours. Not the other way around.

did you look for a guide… Because http://portforward.com/ has a guide for basically every router in existence.

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:551492”]So you’re trying to connect your fiances server to yours?
Or your computer to hers? Because… There’s a huge difference in the two…

Is that IP your ip found on whatismyip?

Also, make sure to check your portforward rules. Most computer’s IPv4 addresses are not static, and will change… If you didn’t set yours to static it could be the root of the issue.
And make sure you put inbound/outbound firewall rules for port 43594 as well.[/quote]

I’m trying to connect my computer to hers, the ip i gave you is my ipv4 address and not sure if i set it to static and i couldnt find exactly a guide on portforward so i did it myself my router is tp-link so its pretty basic. i have this. and yes the service port i have it selcted to “select one”

Read full topic

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So you’re trying to connect your fiances server to yours?
Or your computer to hers? Because… There’s a huge difference in the two…

Is that IP your ip found on whatismyip?

Also, make sure to check your portforward rules. Most computer’s IPv4 addresses are not static, and will change… If you didn’t set yours to static it could be the root of the issue.
And make sure you put inbound/outbound firewall rules for port 43594 as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:551492”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=670407.msg4482917#msg4482917 date=1431460268]
I know what you mean, but what im saying is i tried our ip from “whatismyip” also i tried my host link from no-ip.biz which is “ebah.no-ip.biz” i just tried my “ipv4” or whatever nothing is working im not sure whats going on… the computer im using for local host is mine, the computer im tryna connect to is my fiance’s in the living room…
[/quote]
You didn’t state that once, until now.
How many times do I need to tell you, that when you post an issue on these forums, you need to give us all the details possible.

Which computer is the server being hosted on? Your fiances?

No it’s being hosted on mine, here is the server = ip i have server = "192.168.56.1";[/quote]

Read full topic

You didn’t state that once, until now.

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:551492”]Did you read anything that I said…?
127.0.0.1 points to itself… Not another computer. If there was a physical way to represent what local host does, it’d be this:

Yeah… The connection doesn’t go anywhere but to itself.

What IP address are you using, and what computer are you connecting to?[/quote]

I know what you mean, but what im saying is i tried our ip from “whatismyip” also i tried my host link from no-ip.biz which is “ebah.no-ip.biz” i just tried my “ipv4” or whatever nothing is working im not sure whats going on… the computer im using for local host is mine, the computer im tryna connect to is my fiance’s in the living room…

Read full topic

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Did you read anything that I said…?
127.0.0.1 points to itself… Not another computer. If there was a physical way to represent what local host does, it’d be this:

Yeah… The connection doesn’t go anywhere but to itself.

What IP address are you using, and what computer are you connecting to?

Read full topic

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:551492”]You tried to connect to a server on a different computer using 127.0.0.1?
127.0.0.1 is localhost. Which means, LOCAL only. A.K.A, only your PC. So if you set the IP address to 127.0.0.1, that would mean you’re trying to connect to a port on your computer.
If you want to connect to a computer on the same network, you need to change the IP address to the IPv4 address of that computer (The ip that people use to port forward, and is found in the windows network and sharing center)

If you want to connect to a computer outside the network, you must connect to it via their broadcast IP (The IP that can be found on http://whatismyip.com )

Note: It should/may be possible to connect to the computer on the same network using their broadcast IP[/quote]

I dont know whats going on i done it before, now its not working… mhmm…

Read full topic

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You tried to connect to a server on a different computer using 127.0.0.1?
127.0.0.1 is localhost. Which means, LOCAL only. A.K.A, only your PC. So if you set the IP address to 127.0.0.1, that would mean you’re trying to connect to a port on your computer.
If you want to connect to a computer on the same network, you need to change the IP address to the IPv4 address of that computer (The ip that people use to port forward, and is found in the windows network and sharing center)

If you want to connect to a computer outside the network, you must connect to it via their broadcast IP (The IP that can be found on http://whatismyip.com )

Note: It should/may be possible to connect to the computer on the same network using their broadcast IP

Read full topic
